definition: to dodge/to sidestep
surname Shan

to dodge/to duck out of the way/to beat it/shaken (by a fall)/to sprain/to pull a muscle/lightning/spark/a flash/to flash (across one's mind)/to leave behind/(Internet slang) (of a display of affection) "dazzlingly" saccharine
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from

sentences.english: Paralyzing Touch I - Counterattack that stuns your opponent for 15 seconds or until they are hit.
sentences.chinese: 打暈目標15秒，只能在一次成功閃避後使用。

sentences.english: Felspine the Greater in Shadowmoon Valley will no longer evade when engaged.
sentences.chinese: 影月谷的魔脊龍在激活後不會再進入“閃避模式”。

sentences.english: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.
sentences.chinese: 牠閃避海浪，以儲備魔法的波動。

sentences.english: He made a sudden dodge aside.
God help me, I cannot dodge them all!
sentences.chinese: 希望上帝保佑我，我可無法閃避所有槍頭。

sentences.english: His witty one-line responses deftly fending off unwanted questions?
sentences.chinese: 他風趣簡短的回答機靈的閃避了不想正面回覆的問題？

sentences.english: The unconscious evinces knowledge that , for the most part, escapes the speaking being.
sentences.chinese: 無意識閃躲知識，大部份時間，還閃避說話的主體。

sentences.english: "I can't give you an answer now, " he hedged.
sentences.chinese: 髎“我現在不能回答你，”他閃避道。

sentences.english: Evade indicates how well you can evade physical attacks.
sentences.chinese: 閃避表示角色躲避物理攻擊的機率。

sentences.english: Increases your chances to parry and dodge attacks by 75% for 10 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 提高你的招架和閃避攻擊的機率75%，持續10秒。

sentences.english: And it's not just politicians who evade answering tough questions.
sentences.chinese: 而且並不只是政治家纔會閃避問題。

sentences.english: Druids now need substantially less agility per dodge.
sentences.chinese: 德魯依閃避時所需敏捷下降。

sentences.english: A jook space is arranged at the bottom of the middle slide-way.
sentences.chinese: 在中滑軌的底部設置有一閃避空間。

definition: dangers spring up all around (idiom); surrounded by perils
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
hit by a bullet/shot
to abrade/to scrape/to chafe/to graze/abrasion/friction burn/scratch
to pursue closely
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to brake (when driving)
to hit (a target etc)/to strike
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
lamppost
obstacle/hindrance
enemy
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to stop/to obstruct
